'''Adept Manager''' is a [[graphical user interface]] to the [[Advanced Packaging Tool]] for [[KDE]]. Adept was developed by Peter RoÄkai and was sponsored by [[Canonical Ltd.]] through the [[Kubuntu]] project, where it replaced the Kynaptic package manager.
â
Adept 2 is for KDE 3. The last stable release was 2.1.3. Adept 3 is for KDE 4. At the end of 2008 development was discontinued as Adept was replaced by [[KPackageKit]] for [[Kubuntu#Releases|Kubuntu's Jaunty Jackalope]] release.<ref>[http://web.mornfall.net/blog/farewell__44___adept.html "farewell, adept"], notice on the project website. December 17, 2008.</ref>
+
Adept 2 is for KDE 3. The last stable release was 2.1.3. Adept 3 is for KDE 4. At the end of 2008 development was discontinued as Adept was replaced by [[KPackageKit]] for [[Kubuntu#Releases|Kubuntu's 9.04]] release.<ref>[http://web.mornfall.net/blog/farewell__44___adept.html "farewell, adept"], notice on the project website. December 17, 2008.</ref>
